urls.title: River Lea 'Rainy Days' sewer spill alerts - London Waterkeeper
urls.description: This email focuses on the Lea Valley inside the M25. It is this section of the River Lea which has the worst water quality. The two most significant sewer overflows are from Deephams sewage works in Edmonton and Mulberry Court in the Olympic Park. Deephams was upgraded recently so we need to know if it [‚Ä¶]

There are many national & global corps operating in the area too as well as @thameswater @HighwaysSEAST @TfL @LDN_environment

@SaveLeaMarshes @mayorofhackney @HackneyLabour @EnvAgency @LeeValleyPark @MeridianWater @stormwater_jo .@Thames21 ranks this location as 2nd highest #roadrunoff #pollution treatment opportunity within #LondonLeaCatchment https://t.co/O18uBvgYwC

@SaveLeaMarshes @mayorofhackney @HackneyLabour @EnvAgency A good start would be to depave along the @LeeValleyPark #TottenhamMarshes Watermead Way A1055 to @MeridianWater & install filter drains* This is not a poster park wetlands project but could be done in sections re funding 1/2  * slides by @stormwater_jo https://t.co/4YALyq2pfQ https://t.co/hOtSfO51O6

urls.title: Talk Archive
urls.description: Beginning in the summer of 2020 the Chalk Aquifer Alliance have been able to present a series of talks pertinent to chalk streams and the challenges they face, thanks to the generosity of both Bury‚Ä¶

tweets.text:
@mayorofhackney @HackneyLabour @EnvAgency Well said Phil! 

The Lee Valley Regional Park Authority needs to follow Hackney Council's lead & call the responsible authorities to account. https://t.co/AF0QGxa8jp
@mayorofhackney @EnvAgency Misplumbed connections are some of the worse pollutants. We need to ensure our surface water drainage remains just that.

@EnvAgencyMids I'm fed up of you saying there's unlikely to be 'long-term' health impacts. What about our stress & anxiety levels? Sleep deprivation? Our inability to go outside for exercise? I've cried every day this week because the odour has worsened. We've had no respite from this hell.
